name: Parry Lodge

reviews.title: Nice little piece of history
reviews.text: The Parry lodge was alright for the the price. The room was a little old and worn but OK. The location in the middle of town is excellent. The breakfast in the main building was excellent for the price. All in all a good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first night of our "Utah Spring Break" on the way to Bryce, Zion and Capitol Reef and couldn't wait to return for our last night! We stayed in the Dean Martin room. You can't beat the value, and the attitude of the staff is positive, warm and full of pride. If you can love a motel, stay here! It's very classic, and upbeat! Kanab is a great place!
reviews.title: How FUN!

likes.liked: — The Hollywood history is everywhere! It's a well preserved slice of movie making!
likes.disliked: — Kanab basically closes down on Sunday..........make sure you are prepared with what you need!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 nights right after Christmas. I had originally booked the Best Western Red Hills, but after having done some more research, decided to go with Parry Lodge to save some money. I had originally planned on only staying one night, but I ended up staying five due to all the things to see in the area. The rooms themselves are not spectacular, but clean and more than sufficient. The beds are a bit old and soft. But for $36/night with a AAA discount, it sure beat camping in the sub-freezing desert temperatures. The heater worked well at keeping us warm at night, although hot water seemed a bit limited. There seemed to be enough for one person, but in the middle of the second person's shower, it would start getting cold. The complimentary continental breakfast was also quite nice - they had a variety of cereals, milk, coffee, OJ, mini muffins, and english muffins, and jelly. Overall, I felt it was a great value for the money. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: A piece of history

reviews.text: found on the internet prior to flying out to see canyon. did not have opportunity to enjoy lodge very long, just 2 nights, but really enjoyed our stay. the history associated with lodge & town was a big plus for us. really enjoyed the memorbilia and touring the grounds & your town. plan to return in summer of 2008 & plan to stay for possibly 4-5 days. looking forward to. and no we are not old farts, in our 30's... hope this place hangs around for the long haul!
reviews.title: Loved the Parry Lodge

likes.disliked: — needs a little updating in respect to rooms, better qualtiy linens, towels, new carpet, paint,etc

reviews.text: thanks for a glimpse into the past.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.text: I was back and forth about which town and which hotel our family of two adults and four children should stay in for our jaunts to Bryce and Zion. Well, I ended up chossing the Parry Lodge for two nights and was glad I did! I stumbled upon it about a week before we left, reading about it in a Mobil guidebook. I phoned the lodge and they had a "family" room available, two connecting queen bedded rooms with kitchenette, for $92 plus tax. Rollaways could be provided for $6 extra. We rolled into town about 9 pm after a long day at Zion National Park. Friendly helpful front desk staff. We got to our room and yes, not the Fairmont, but just as described, with plenty of room for all, full sized fridge, sink, range, two TVs. The bathroom was small and the shower went hot and cold, but who's expecting great water pressure in an old hotel? The room wasn't spotless. Pool was nice and right next to our room. We did not try the breakfast buffet, so can't comment on that. We really liked being right in middle of Kanab - many choices for restaurants and shopping within walking distance. We watched the 8 pm movie in the Old Barn out back (free for lodge guests) - Thunderhead, Son of Flicka, which was filmed in the area. If you want a spotless, modern hotel, this place is not for you. If you want a real taste of small town hospitality and character, stay here!
reviews.title: Happy we stayed here!

reviews.text: Fell into the Parry lodge on accident after a previous night at the unacceptable Shilo Inn. This property boasted excellent atmosphere and a sense of belonging! The staff was always helpful and friendly and our room was ultra retro cool. We stayed in the "Sammy Davis Jr" room. I loved the old Hollywood feel. The restaurant serves only breakfast buffet which was excellent each of the 3 days we stayed. If you are snobby and need a Hilton with room service this is not the place for you, but then neither is the town of Kanab. If you want a true glimpse of American History don't pass on the Parry Lodge!
reviews.title: Must visit on your American West Experience!

likes.liked: — The Eclectic Feel of the place

reviews.text: Our room was overpriced - at any price. Worst bed I've ever slept in - including camping! Hard and musty smelling. No one got any sleep that night . The carpet was old and musty too. This room needs renovating - at least fix the mattress if you're going to advertise as being a motel rather than a museum. The breakfast bar was bad also. The pancakes were brittle, eggs old and fruit was poor.
reviews.title: check out your room first!

reviews.text: Sorry to be so negative, but for what they charge this place should be comfortable, at least. I felt like an idiot to pay $75 for this awful experience. (room 169).
reviews.title: Parry's Lodge Always The Best
Old Hollywood Westerns Come Alive
reviews.text: Parry's Lodge is great! The morning breakfast has great service and the rooms are grand! Not only that, Parry's goes above and beyond to serve its customers. I even think during holidays and celebrations for instance like Western Legends; Parry's gives Kanab that sparkle that it deserves. Pretty inside and out, great food, great service!

reviews.title: This has got to be the worst place I have stayed - small, smelly and noisy!
reviews.text: This has got to the worst place we have ever stayed in the US. We were so disappointed on arrival that we tried to cancel our reservation. Both the bedroom and shower room were tiny and scruffy. The bed was uncomfortable with a wafer thin pillow. The shower room was smelly. The shower head was so low you had to crouch to use it (no bath tub). The sink unit obstructed the entrance to the shower. There was no hairdryer (no big deal perhaps but it was the only place we stayed during our vacation without one). The paint was peeling off the toilet seat. It was also noisy and as a result, we hardly slept. Need I say more...!
What a little gem!!! We read about Parry lodge in our lonely planet guide and as we were planning on going to Bryce, Zion and Grand Canyon found it an ideal base!
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was basic clean and oversized and the price was great.
reviews.title: Find somewhere else.
A Nice Place
reviews.text: Kanab itself was a nice town and we were given recommendations for food from the hotel and they were very good.

reviews.title: The Perfect Parry
reviews.text: We stayed in Anne Baxter room - we loved the connections to the old movies and the wall of black and white photographs in the lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at night and we checked out very quickly. The room was very nice, very clean and the bed was very big. We stayed at Omar Shariff´s room. The place was very quiet and, though it was a little bit hot inside, we could open the window because there was a fly net.
reviews.title: i would repeat

reviews.text: In the morning the breakfast buffet was great: eggs, toast, fruit, cereals... We ate all we could and more. And when we saw the area where the motel was with the light of the day... It was very beautiful, with red rocks everywhere.
reviews.title: Great Family reunion at the Parry Lodge

likes.disliked: — No extra amenities in the rooms

reviews.text: We will repeat if we come back to Kanab and i´ll recomend it to all my friends.
reviews.title: We're ready for our 3rd and 4th stays!

likes.disliked: — I can't think of a thing...

reviews.text: My family chose the Parry Lodge due to it's availability to accommodate our family reunion of 60 plus people. We went into the stay with no expectations. We were presently surprised. The rooms were very clean; comfort level was average but acceptable. It was a great place to use as a base of operations for our reunion as we went about our day trips to the Grand Canyon, Bryce and Zion canyons. (If you have a chance check out the Moqui cave. Lots of education about the area). The pool was very nice and open until 10 pm which was a nice way to end the day with lots of people who only come together once a year. The rooms with the stars names on them were really fun. The nostalgia factor was at a 10 and the movie barn added to it. In a town where most of it rolls up the sidewalks (so to speak) at 8 pm, it is nice to be able to just walk across from your room and catch a free movie that was filmed right around the corner. The buffet breakfast was good and plentiful. Here is what made this trip really special. The staff. Very friendly! While eating breakfast one morning my 3 year old son refused everything. Just as we were leaving he spotted the container of Fruit loops cereal. He asked for some but we were leaving. One of the staff overheard our exchange and ran to get a Ziploc bag and filled it up for us to take along with us. I was thrilled that he would make the effort. They were also very accommodating at breakfast for our large group and made sure we were able to all sit together. We are already thinking about our next reunion and would love to have it here again.
reviews.title: stayed 3 days and loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is one of my favorite hotels in the WORLD! Great location, atmosphere to wallow in, utterly charming. The "old movie" rooms are great, but there's also a more modern section. The hotel will try to accommodate your wishes. We always ask for the older rooms, extremely comfortable and spacious. Great breakfast too. Our waitress had served Jodie Foster among others. The staff is delightful also.
reviews.title: Central location

description: Founded in 1931 by the three Parry brothers Whitney (Whit), Chauncey (Chaunce) and Gronway (Gron), Parry Lodge has hosted some of the biggest names from the golden age of Hollywood. John Wayne, Frank Sinatra, Olivia De Havilland, Gregory Peck, Maureen O'Hara, Tyrone Power, Linda Darnell, Robert Taylor, Anne Bancroft, Dean Martin, Lana Turner, Clint Eastwood and Barbara Stanwyck are just a few of the hundreds of stars and character players that stayed at Parry's while filming in the many scenic locales in and around Kanab, Utah. Now owned by Kanab native Steve Heaton, centrally located Parry Lodge can be your base of operations as you visit Grand Canyon, Zion and Bryce Canyon National Parks, Glen Canyon (Lake Powell) National Recreations Area, Grand Staircase - Escalante and Pipe Springs National Monuments. These incredible natural wonders are all a 90 minute drive or less from Kanab and form a grand circle with Parry Lodge as its hub. When visiting Zion National Park, be sure to visit the Zion Canyon Theatre and stay at the new Cable Mountain Lodge. Parry Lodge is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
